name: Ancient Literature Quiz | Literature Before 1900 | 10 Questions

questions.text: This author is best known for writing about myths and fables
questions.explanation:
Aesop.

	Aesop's Fables. Demosthenes is best known as an orator.

Virgil.

	Considered one of the classics.

questions.text: This man met his fate - he was murdered - as a result of Roman politics involving Marc Antony and Augustus Caesar.
questions.explanation:
Cicero.

	These boys play rough. It's not wise to make powerful enemies.

questions.text: This author is best known for his biographical 'Lives'
questions.explanation:
Plutarch.

	Pliny is known for his 'Natural History'

questions.text: This Roman author is famous for his work 'Metamorphoses'
This author is perhaps best known for his trilogy,'The Oresteia'.
questions.explanation:
Aeschylus.

	Euripides is also one of the three great Greek dramatists.

questions.text: This ancient writer was a tutor to Nero, but ended up in an unsuccessful conspiracy against him. With no way out, he took poison.
This author fought alongside Brutus against Antony and Augustus Caesar
questions.explanation:
Horace.

	He apparently found it better to be a writer than a soldier.

questions.text: This author is perhaps best known for 'Antigone' and his writings about Oedipus.
questions.explanation:
Sophocles.

	Also one of the three great Greek dramatists. Aristophanes primarily wrote comedy and satire.

questions.text: This author was a prominent Roman historian
questions.explanation:
Livy.

	Thucydides and Herodotus were historians - but they were Greek, not Roman.
